com.github.mikephil.charting.data

Class ChartData<T extends DataSet<? extends Entry>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.mikephil.charting.data.ChartData<T>
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BarLineScatterCandleBubbleData, PieData, RadarData

    public abstract class ChartData<T extends DataSet<? extends Entry>>
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that holds all relevant data that represents the chart. That involves at least one (or more) DataSets, and an array of x-values.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected java.util.List<T> mDataSets
      array that holds all DataSets the ChartData object represents
      protected int mLastEnd
      the last end value used for calcMinMax

      holds all x-values the chart represents
      protected float mYMax
      maximum y-value in the y-value array across all axes
      protected float mYMin
      the minimum y-value in the y-value array across all axes

      • ChartData

        public ChartData(java.util.List<java.lang.String> xVals)
        Constructor for only x-values. This constructor can be used for setting up an empty chart without data.
        Parameters:
        xVals -

      • ChartData

        public ChartData(java.lang.String[] xVals)
        Constructor for only x-values. This constructor can be used for setting up an empty chart without data.
        Parameters:
        xVals -

      • ChartData

        public ChartData(java.util.List<java.lang.String> xVals,
         java.util.List<T> sets)
        constructor for chart data
        Parameters:
        xVals - The values describing the x-axis. Must be at least as long as the highest xIndex in the Entry objects across all DataSets.
        sets - the dataset array

      • ChartData

        public ChartData(java.lang.String[] xVals,
         java.util.List<T> sets)
        constructor that takes string array instead of List string
        Parameters:
        xVals - The values describing the x-axis. Must be at least as long as the highest xIndex in the Entry objects across all DataSets.
        sets - the dataset array

      • getDataSetIndexByLabel

        protected int getDataSetIndexByLabel(java.util.List<T> dataSets,
                         java.lang.String label,
                         boolean ignorecase)
        Retrieve the index of a DataSet with a specific label from the ChartData. Search can be case sensitive or not. IMPORTANT: This method does calculations at runtime, do not over-use in performance critical situations.
        Parameters:
        dataSets - the DataSet array to search
        label -
        ignorecase - if true, the search is not case-sensitive
        Returns:

      • getXValCount

      • removeDataSet

        public boolean removeDataSet(T d)
        Removes the given DataSet from this data object. Also recalculates all minimum and maximum values. Returns true if a DataSet was removed, false if no DataSet could be removed.
        Parameters:
        d -

      • removeDataSet

        public boolean removeDataSet(int index)
        Removes the DataSet at the given index in the DataSet array from the data object. Also recalculates all minimum and maximum values. Returns true if a DataSet was removed, false if no DataSet could be removed.
        Parameters:
        index -

      • addEntry

            int dataSetIndex)
        Adds an Entry to the DataSet at the specified index. Entries are added to the end of the list.

        Parameters:

      • removeEntry

        public boolean removeEntry(int xIndex,
                  int dataSetIndex)
        Removes the Entry object at the given xIndex from the DataSet at the specified index. Returns true if an Entry was removed, false if no Entry was found that meets the specified requirements.
        Parameters:
        xIndex -
        dataSetIndex -
        Returns:

        Returns:

      • getFirstLeft

        public T getFirstLeft()
        Returns the first DataSet from the datasets-array that has it's dependency on the left axis. Returns null if no DataSet with left dependency could be found.
        Returns:

        Returns true if highlighting of all underlying values is enabled, false if not.
        Returns:

      • clearValues

        public void clearValues()
        Clears this data object from all DataSets and removes all Entries. Don't forget to invalidate the chart after this.

      • contains

        public boolean contains(Entry e)
        Checks if this data object contains the specified Entry. Returns true if so, false if not. NOTE: Performance is pretty bad on this one, do not over-use in performance critical situations.
        Parameters:
        e -
        Returns:
